cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles southeast of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: continues west-northwest across the Greater Antilles this weekend, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday and arc northwest toward the Louisiana–upper Texas coast by Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Vermilion/Terrebonne Bay area)

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: Borderline/No (Houston lies just west of the day-5 cone edge)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches/warnings confined to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Hispaniola, eastern & central Cuba and portions of the Bahamas at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as above – no U.S. Gulf Coast warnings yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Potential impact zone Tuesday–Wednesday spans the northwest Gulf from the upper Texas coast eastward to the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely unless track shifts west toward Texas
weather_observation.wind: Only a 4 % chance of 34-kt (gale) winds within 5 days; strongest winds most likely to remain east of Houston
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible on upper Texas coast if the storm shifts west, but significant (>3 ft) surge not indicated by current guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible late Wednesday–Thursday; widespread heavy rainfall not presently expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Marine/operational impacts include long-period swells and elevated seas in the Gulf beginning late Tuesday
